column4: Anyone available to help me troubleshoot some phpmyadmin installation problems in ubuntu jaunty??
not at all, do you want to follow a howto?
its because you have this block called # Authorized for setup  .... comment that block out, and it should work
no, I have ur file on pastebin, I'll fix it, and give it to you
I made that change but still, http://zephyrnetwork.ca/phpmyadmin doesn't exist
what's the main domain its on?
http://wiki.phpmyadmin.net/pma/ubuntu (when i install phpmyadmin it doesn't ask me if i want to use apache2, it just installs itself automatically)
im thinking this might be the issue
this time it asked me a bunch of information, including if i wanted it for apache2 still no go on the 404 but im going to check the conf file to see if it didn't get reverted
you wanna just manually install PHPMyAdmin, it would be much easier
sudo ln -s /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf /etc/apache2/conf.d/phpmyadmin.conf (running this and restarting apache worked)
it must be that you had to restart apache :P
